attributes.action: Make the increased maintenance grant for students in higher education applicable to all students studying in 2008/2009 and not just those starting that year
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On 5 July 2007, the Rt Hon John Denham announced an increase in the threshold of household income by which students become entitled to a maintenance (non-repayable) grant. Students whose household income is below £25,000 can now claim the full grant (previous threshold £17,500), and students whose household income falls below £60,000 are eligible for a partial grant (previous threshold £37,500).

However a clause in his statement reads ‘The new arrangements come into effect from the academic year 2008/09; they apply only to full-time undergraduates who start university in 2008. Students already in the system continue to have access to the improved package of support introduced in 2006’

This means that 2006 & 2007 entrants whose household income lies between £25,000 and £45,000 will be between £700 and £1,100 a year worse off than their counterparts who start their courses in 2008 (These statistics are available on the governments' own website).
